alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 14 at 10:44AM MST until July 14 at 1:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE PIPELINE BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR COCONINO COUNTY... At 1043 AM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Pipeline Burn Scar. Rain guages in the area have indicated just under 3/4 of an inch of rainfall in 15 minutes. This WILL result in debris flow, specifically down the Government Tank wash! Avoid the area!!! HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding across the Pipeline Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Pipeline Burn Scar. Debris flows HIGHLY likely! Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Flagstaff, Timberline, Hutchison Acres and Little Elden Spring Horse Camp. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 423 and 427. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... San Francisco Wash and Schultz Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Immediately move out of and away from creeks and washes in the Pipeline Burn Scar. Flash flooding is occurring or imminent. Turn Around, Don`t Drown if you encounter flood waters while driving. Avoid recently burned areas and downstream locations. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry washes will occur. Rockslides and mudslides will likely occur in steep terrain. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life.
